H1348.def: = state in which a substance increases in volume, which manifests itself in an increasing height

H5850.def: = circular or semi-circular ornamental headdress, ◄ usually made out of precious metals and decorated with jewels, ► worn by kings, priests, and officials as a symbol of authority and status; also given to women by their suitors to win their affection

H669.def: = man, tribe, and territory; ◄ son of {L:Joseph<SDBH:יֹוסֵף>}; ► founder of one of the tribes of {L:Israel<SDBH:יִשְׂרָאֵל>}

H7910.def: = state in which humans are intoxicated ◄ as a result of having had too much alcohol

H5034.def: = process by which plants and their products become devoid of moisture, and therefore lose color and bend over ► which may ultimately result in death if circumstances do not change; ≈ associated with drought and destruction, often as punishment from God

H6731.def: = flower that appears with the new growth on trees and shrubs before they produce their fruit

H834.def: = a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner

H7218.def: = upper part of the human body, or the front or upper part of the body of an animal, typically separated from the rest of the body by a neck, and containing the brain, mouth, and sense organs; ≈ associated with the entire person, that person's life, and that person's responsibilities

H8081.def: = high quality {L:oil<SDBH:שֶׁמֶן>}, ◄ extracted from the fruits of the olive tree during the first pressing; ► used as food, medicine, fuel, perfume (when mixed with spices), and other purposes; also used in various religious rituals; ≈ associated with joy, but also known for its softness, smoothness, and elusiveness

H1516.def: = a land depression sided or encircled by mountains or elevations

H1986.def: = action by which humans or animals deliver a blow to an object with their hands, whether or not with the help of an instrument such as a {L:hammer<SDBH:הַלְמוּת>}, or with their feet

H3196.def: = dark red alcoholic liquid; ◄ made out of grapes through the process of fermentation; ► used as beverage, though to be avoided by Nazirites, and by priests when on duty; ≈ associated with joy and well-being, but also with drunkenness and foolishness; used as metaphor for anger, aggressive behavior, and sex{N:001}

H136.def: originally a plural construct with first person singular suffix of {L:אָדֹון<SDBH:אָדֹון>}: = way of addressing God as master and lord

H2389.def: = state in which humans or deities are strong in a physical, political, or military sense

H533.def: = state in which humans and deities have physical, political, and/or military strength

H2230.def: = process by which copious amounts of water flow from the skies, often accompanied by strong winds and having a destructive effect

H1259.def: = pellets of frozen rain falling from the sky; ≈ associated with destruction

H6986.def: = event that causes the end of a large number of people

H4325.def: = water as the indispensible liquid on which the existence of all life depends, used for drinking, preparing food, washing, irrigating, etc.; found under the earth, on the earth, and above the earth; sometimes used as a euphemism to denote certain body liquids; ≈ associated with abundance and refreshment, but also with instability, and danger, etc.

H3524.def: = state in which humans, deities or substances have great power and strength

H5117.def: = action by which humans or animals stop their current or regular activities, ► often with the purpose of recovering their strength

H3027.def: = the lower part of the upper limb of the human body, which in some contexts may include the full arm, ► apart from basic human activities such as holding, giving and taking, working, beating, also used in rituals around blessings, oaths, and prayer; ≈ used figuratively in expressions involving strength, control, responsibility, punishment; ≈ possibly used as a euphemism for the male genitals

H776.def: = the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land

H1348.def: = state in which a substance increases in volume, which manifests itself in an increasing height

H5850.def: = circular or semi-circular ornamental headdress, ◄ usually made out of precious metals and decorated with jewels, ► worn by kings, priests, and officials as a symbol of authority and status; also given to women by their suitors to win their affection

H669.def: = man, tribe, and territory; ◄ son of {L:Joseph<SDBH:יֹוסֵף>}; ► founder of one of the tribes of {L:Israel<SDBH:יִשְׂרָאֵל>}

H7910.def: = state in which humans are intoxicated ◄ as a result of having had too much alcohol

H7429.def: = action by which humans, deities, or animals tread heavily and noisily on people, plants, or objects; ► usually with the purpose of killing, destroying, desecrating, and/or humiliating

H7272.def: = the lower part of the lower limb of the body of humans, animals, and --by extension-- of deities, which in some contexts may include the full leg; ► used for standing and walking; ≈ associated with authority, and also used as a euphemism for the male genitals

H5034.def: = process by which plants and their products become devoid of moisture, and therefore lose color and bend over ► which may ultimately result in death if circumstances do not change; ≈ associated with drought and destruction, often as punishment from God

H6733.def: = flower that appears with the new growth on trees and shrubs before they produce their fruit

H834.def: = a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner

H7218.def: = upper part of the human body, or the front or upper part of the body of an animal, typically separated from the rest of the body by a neck, and containing the brain, mouth, and sense organs; ≈ associated with the entire person, that person's life, and that person's responsibilities

H8081.def: = high quality {L:oil<SDBH:שֶׁמֶן>}, ◄ extracted from the fruits of the olive tree during the first pressing; ► used as food, medicine, fuel, perfume (when mixed with spices), and other purposes; also used in various religious rituals; ≈ associated with joy, but also known for its softness, smoothness, and elusiveness

H1516.def: = a land depression sided or encircled by mountains or elevations

H1063.def: = fruit of the {L:fig<SDBH:תְּאֵנָה>} tree, of the variety that ripens early (in June); ► appreciated because of their fine flavor

H2962.def: = a marker pointing to the time preceding a particular point in time

H7019.def: = hot season of the year, opposite of {L:חֹרֶף<SDBH:חֹרֶף>}; ► time when most crops are harvested and preparations are made for the cold season; ≈ sometimes associated with excessive heat and drought, and also with hard work

H7200.def: = process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily --though not necessarily exclusively-- with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something

H853.def: exact meaning unknown; possibly: = wooden handle with an iron head that has both an adze and a chisel as its ends; ► used for breaking up moderately hard soil to make it ready for cultivation

H3709.def: = the inner part of the human {L:hand<SDBH:יָד>}, but with special focus on the activities performed with it, such as holding, covering, or lifting objects, leaning on a staff, clapping, etc.

H1104.def: = action by which humans or animals cause food to pass down from their mouth to their esophagus; ≈ often used figuratively to denote destruction and death

H3117.def: = the time of day that it is light, as opposed to the time that it is dark

H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H6635.def: = state of being in the service of the community; ≈ sometimes associated with suffering and heavy labor

H5850.def: = circular or semi-circular ornamental headdress, ◄ usually made out of precious metals and decorated with jewels, ► worn by kings, priests, and officials as a symbol of authority and status; also given to women by their suitors to win their affection

H6843.def: exact meaning unsure, probably: = circular band worn around the head; ≈ associated with a position of honor and repect

H7307.def: = an invisible being that is in a direct relation to and under control of God and one of his manifestation, often described as a substance that can be poured out, ► through whom the universe is created and animated; it can manifest itself as an invisible force equipping humans with wisdom, skill, and strength for specific tasks; it can also manifest itself as a movement of air through the bodies of animate creatures (breath) or through nature (wind)

H4941.def: = a situation where one party has a dispute with another party, and is looking for a legal ruling in which they receive what they consider to be rightfully theirs

H3427.def: = action by which humans assume a sitting position in a certain location and remain in that position for some time; ≈ sometimes associated with a certain status, role, or common activity

H1369.def: = the ability to accomplish great things because of characteristics, such as physical strength, power, bravery, skill, wealth, good character, or a combination thereof

H7725.def: = action by which humans face a direction different from the one they were facing before

H4421.def: = armed conflict between different countries or different groups within a country

H428.def: = marker identifying a set of multiple objects with a set that already exists in the mind of the hearers

H1571.def: marker pointing to information that needs to be considered in addition to previous information (either explicit or implied)

H7686.def: = action by which animals move about without apparent purpose or destination

H3196.def: = dark red alcoholic liquid; ◄ made out of grapes through the process of fermentation; ► used as beverage, though to be avoided by Nazirites, and by priests when on duty; ≈ associated with joy and well-being, but also with drunkenness and foolishness; used as metaphor for anger, aggressive behavior, and sex{N:001}

H7941.def: = alcoholic liquid; ◄ made out of dates through the process of fermentation; ► used as beverage, though to be avoided by Nazirites, and by priests when on duty; ≈ associated with joy and well-being, but also with drunkenness and foolishness{N:001}

H3548.def: = person {L:ordained<SDBH:מלא>} and {L:consecrated<SDBH:קדשׁ>} to perform religious services on behalf of others

H5030.def: = male person speaking on behalf of a deity

H1104.def: = action by which humans or animals cause food to pass down from their mouth to their esophagus; ≈ often used figuratively to denote destruction and death

H7203.def: = someone who receives divine messages, primarily by means of visions

H6328.def: = state in which an object stands unsteadily

H6417.def: = action by which someone gives a verdict on a case or person in a dispute and ensures that the verdict is implemented, which, ideally, results in relief for the innocent and punishment for the guilty; this can only be done by someone in authority, such as a judge or ruler or even God himself

H7979.def: literally: something that has been spread out; hence: = a flat surface on which food has been spread out for eating ◄ usually made of wood but can be a piece of animal skin or leather ► used in private and public occasions, and frequently for sacred uses in the tabernacle and temple

H4390.def: = state or process in which a certain location, container, or surface is filled or covered with so many objects that little or no space is left

H4725.def: = a specific area or point in space

H1097.def: = particle marking a proposition as not true

H6675.def: = excrement; ◄ produced by humans; ► source of pollution and impurity; ≈ regarded as filthy and therefore associated with sinfulness

H853.def: exact meaning unknown; possibly: = wooden handle with an iron head that has both an adze and a chisel as its ends; ► used for breaking up moderately hard soil to make it ready for cultivation

H4310.def: = a reference to an unknown person or deity; normally used with the purpose of identifying that person or deity; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that person or deity cannot be identified

H1844.def: = state in which humans or deities are acquainted with facts, truths, or principles, as a result of experience, study or investigation

H995.def: = state in which someone has the ability to see through the outward appearance of things and grasp their essence

H1580.def: = causative process by which a mother causes her baby to become accustomed to food other than its mother's milk

H2461.def: = white fluid; ◄ secreted by women and female mammals; ► for nourishment of their children or young; also used as food for humans; ≈ highly appreciated and considered high quality food; associated with delight, whiteness, purity, wealth, and well-being; metaphor for beauty, young age; quality, wealth, and sex

H6267.def: literally: taken from the (mother's) breasts; hence: = process by which babies are getting accustomed to food other than the mother's milk; ≈ associated with babies

H6673.def: = legal order that people are expected to obey; ≈ rejected by some as a heavy burden{N:001}

H6957.def: = line ► used for measuring the size of an object; ≈ sometimes used in a figurative sense in the context of moral and ethical standards

H2191.def: = state in which an object is relatively small in size

H3934.def: only used in poetry; = humans who express their disdain of others with words, sounds and/or gestures

H312.def: = pertaining to being different from other objects and events that are in the same range

H3956.def: = the fleshy organ in the mouth, used for tasting, licking, swallowing, and (in the case of humans) speaking

H1696.def: = causative action by which someone exterminates a group of people, either directly or by the hands of someone else

H834.def: = a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner

H559.def: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

H4496.def: literally: rest; hence: = a state of mind in which humans find relief after a time of distress

H5117.def: = action by which humans or animals stop their current or regular activities, ► often with the purpose of recovering their strength

H4774.def: literally: rest; hence: = process by which humans with an agitated and fearful mind find new confidence

H14.def: = state in which someone is willing to do something

H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H6673.def: = legal order that people are expected to obey; ≈ rejected by some as a heavy burden{N:001}

H6957.def: = line ► used for measuring the size of an object; ≈ sometimes used in a figurative sense in the context of moral and ethical standards

H2191.def: = state in which an object is relatively small in size

H1980.def: = process by which liquids or other inanimate objects move from one place to another

H3782.def: = process by which humans trip or temporarily lose their balance when walking; ≈ often used figuratively to denote failure

H268.def: = the side or part of something away from the spectator or from the direction in which it moves or faces

H3369.def: = causative action by which someone places a net or trap in such a way that it is not readily seen ► for the purpose of catching animals and birds; ≈ associated with aggression and oppression

H3920.def: = action by which humans or animals take control of (other) humans, animals, towns or land, usually with violence

H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H582.def: = human being; ◄ created by God; ≈ often associated with weakness, fragility, and mortality

H3944.def: = action by which someone shows contempt for people and ideas

H4910.def: = state in which humans are similar in shape, behavior or experience to others

H834.def: = a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner

H3389.def: = town, formerly referred to as {L:Salem<SDBH:שָׁלֵם>} and {L:Jebus<SDBH:יְבוּס>};◄ located on Mt. {L:Zion<SDBH:צִיֹּון>}; territory of {L:Judah<SDBH:יְהוּדָה>}; ► conquered by king {L:David<SDBH:דָּוִד>}, who made it the capital of his kingdom

H559.def: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

H3772.def: = causative action by which humans use a knife or another sharp implement to remove something from a larger object

H1285.def: = a solemn agreement between two or more parties (persons, groups, nations, deities) with stipulations, blessings, and curses

H854.def: exact meaning unknown; possibly: = wooden handle with an iron head that has both an adze and a chisel as its ends; ► used for breaking up moderately hard soil to make it ready for cultivation

H4194.def: = process by which humans or animals stop living

H6213.def: = causative action by which human or deities produce an object, either personally or by others on behalf of them

H2374.def: = someone who receives divine messages, primarily by means of visions

H7585.def: = abode of the dead, a place of darkness and silence, located deep in the earth and inaccessible, where there is neither compassion nor wisdom; ≈ regarded as a place that is never satisfied; often personified; going there before one's time is considered a punishment

H7760.def: = action by which individuals or groups of humans place themselves in a certain position or configuration

H3577.def: = state in which something that has been said is not truthful

H4268.def: = location where one goes to find protection or safety; ◄ because of difficult circumstances

H8267.def: = state in which humans are not committed towards fulfilling their obligations and show that by their actions

H5641.def: = state in which people or objects are in a location where they cannot be readily seen or where danger cannot reach them

H136.def: originally a plural construct with first person singular suffix of {L:אָדֹון<SDBH:אָדֹון>}: = way of addressing God as master and lord

H3069.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H559.def: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

H3245.def: = causative action by which humans put in place the bottom part of a building or larger structure, usually below the ground level, which will have to bear the entire construction

H68.def: = hard, heavy, and strong substance, ◄ very commonly found in nature,  ► which can be hewn into different shapes by a craftsman

H6726.def: = mountain; ► that part of {L:Jerusalem<SDBH:יְרוּשָׁלַ͏ִם>} on which the temple was built, also known as a fortress and stronghold, city of {L:David<SDBH:דָּוִד>}, YHWH's dwelling place

H976.def: = action by which humans or deities evaluate the dependability and/or reliability of someone else ◄ as an assayer examines ore or metal

H3368.def: = state in which humans or objects are considered valuable and desirable

H6438.def: = a place or angle where two or more sides or edges meet

H4143.def: = the bottom part of a construction, which bears everything built on top of it

H539.def: = state in which an inanimate object is firmly positioned in its place, so that it will not move

H2363.def: = process by which an event happens quickly

H7760.def: = action by which individuals or groups of humans place themselves in a certain position or configuration

H4941.def: = a situation where one party has a dispute with another party, and is looking for a legal ruling in which they receive what they consider to be rightfully theirs

H6957.def: = line ► used for measuring the size of an object; ≈ sometimes used in a figurative sense in the context of moral and ethical standards

H6666.def: = something that one considers one's rightful due

H4949.def: = a weight suspended on the end of a string, ► used by builders to determine whether a wall was straight or not; ≈ often used in a figurative sense in the context of moral and ethical standards

H1259.def: = pellets of frozen rain falling from the sky; ≈ associated with destruction

H3261.def: = causative action by which one inanimate object strikes against another object with strength so that the latter object will be moved from its place and destroyed

H4268.def: = location where one goes to find protection or safety; ◄ because of difficult circumstances

H3577.def: = state in which something that has been said is not truthful

H4325.def: = water as the indispensible liquid on which the existence of all life depends, used for drinking, preparing food, washing, irrigating, etc.; found under the earth, on the earth, and above the earth; sometimes used as a euphemism to denote certain body liquids; ≈ associated with abundance and refreshment, but also with instability, and danger, etc.

H1285.def: = a solemn agreement between two or more parties (persons, groups, nations, deities) with stipulations, blessings, and curses

H854.def: exact meaning unknown; possibly: = wooden handle with an iron head that has both an adze and a chisel as its ends; ► used for breaking up moderately hard soil to make it ready for cultivation

H4194.def: = process by which humans or animals stop living

H3722.def: = causative action by which humans cover objects with a coating of a certain substance

H2380.def: = state of being easily visible because of its size

H7585.def: = abode of the dead, a place of darkness and silence, located deep in the earth and inaccessible, where there is neither compassion nor wisdom; ≈ regarded as a place that is never satisfied; often personified; going there before one's time is considered a punishment

H7752.def: = strip of leather or length of cord fastened to a handle, ► used for beating a person or urging on an animal

H4823.def: = action by which humans or animals tread heavily and noisily on people, plants, or objects; ► usually with the purpose of killing, destroying, desecrating, and/or humiliating

H1767.def: = state of being sufficient in quantity for a given purpose

H853.def: exact meaning unknown; possibly: = wooden handle with an iron head that has both an adze and a chisel as its ends; ► used for breaking up moderately hard soil to make it ready for cultivation

H1242.def: = first half of the day, ranging from daybreak until noon; ≈ used figuratively to denote relief after a time of suffering, and associated with good as opposed to evil

H3117.def: = the time of day that it is light, as opposed to the time that it is dark

H3915.def: = the time of day that is characterized by darkness; ≈ associated with sleep, fear, evil, and hardship

H995.def: = state in which someone has the ability to see through the outward appearance of things and grasp their essence

H2113.def: = causative process by which an event causes people to shake with fear

H4702.def: = a piece of furniture upon which a person reclines or lies down

H4541.def: = a physical likeness or representation of a person, animal, or thing; ◄ made by pouring molten metal into a mold, ► and functioning as an object of non-sanctioned worship

H3664.def: causative action by which humans or deities cause humans or objects to come together in one location

H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H2022.def: = a relatively high elevation of the earth’s surface; generally higher than a {L:hill<SDBH:גִּבְעָה>}

H6559.def: = mountain, also known as {L:Baal-Perazim<SDBH:בַּעַל־פְרָצִים>}; ► location where king {L:David<SDBH:דָּוִד>} defeated the {L:Philistines<SDBH:פְּלִשְׁתִּי>}

H7264.def: = process by which humans or objects shake involuntarily; ◄ typically as a result of fear, insecurity, shock, excitement, or other emotions

H1391.def: = town; ◄ territory of {L:Benjamin<SDBH:בִּנְיָמִן>}; ► one of the four {L:Hivite<SDBH:חִוִּי>} cities that made a covenant with {L:Joshua<SDBH:יְהֹושׁוּעַ>}

H6213.def: = causative action by which human or deities produce an object, either personally or by others on behalf of them

H4639.def: = an activity performed by a person or deity

H5647.def: = state in which humans, either as individuals or as groups, are in a position of subservience towards (other) individuals or groups, which is normally accompanied by a number of duties, tasks and obligations

H5237.def: = state in which something or someone is identified as different or strange from one's own perspective

H6258.def: = a reference to the actual time when a particular event takes place

H3887.def: = someone who shows contempt for other people and ideas

H4147.def: = material used to tie objects together or to tie animals or humans; ≈ associated with power and control over something or someone else

H2388.def: = state in which humans or deities are strong in a physical, political, or military sense, or simply in their ability to convince others with words

H854.def: exact meaning unknown; possibly: = wooden handle with an iron head that has both an adze and a chisel as its ends; ► used for breaking up moderately hard soil to make it ready for cultivation

H136.def: originally a plural construct with first person singular suffix of {L:אָדֹון<SDBH:אָדֹון>}: = way of addressing God as master and lord

H3069.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H6635.def: = state of being in the service of the community; ≈ sometimes associated with suffering and heavy labor

H2782.def: literally: to sharpen one's tongue; hence: = action by which  humans or animals show aggression to someone else with sounds or in speech

H3617.def: = process by which an activity comes to full completion

H776.def: = the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land

H238.def: = to make an effort to hear the words spoken by someone else

H7181.def: = action by which humans or deities pay close attention in order to be able to hear what (other) humans might be saying, or to pick up other sounds and react to if needed

H565.def: = words spoken by humans and deities; often remembered and recorded

H2790.def: = causative action by which someone makes incised marks on a surface of wood or stone with the help of a sharp and hard tool

H2232.def: = action by which humans scatter seeds or plant young plants in a field so that they may grow into a new crop; ≈ associated with the concept of investing in order to get a return; also associated with reproduction and perpetuation

H3117.def: = the time of day that it is light, as opposed to the time that it is dark

H6605.def: = process by which objects open up ► in order to give access to something located inside or to create a passage

H7702.def: = causative action by which someone breaks the soil with the help of a plow, pulled by domestic animals; ► to make it ready for cultivation; ≈ usually regarded as a strenuous task which requires much energy

H127.def: = the surface of the earth, containing the substance that God used to create animals and humans, and to which they return when they die; on this surface plants and trees grow, humans labor to grow crops and worship God, who sustains all life, but who can also strike it with a curse so that nothing grows again

H518.def: = marker indicating that the event in focus has to be true before another event can take place

H2236.def: = causative action by which someone takes a quantity of a dry substance or a liquid with one's hand and scatters it over an object

H7100.def: = a cultivated plant that grows to around 30 cm high and has a lacy leaf like dill or carrot and a greenish-blue flower with five petals; the base of the flower becomes a seedpod that contains many round, black, sharp-smelling seeds; ► used in cooking

H3646.def: meaning unsure; probably: = a plant of the same family as the carrot, reaching a height of 50-60 cm; it branches from the base and has similar leaves and flowers, though its seeds have a sharper smell; ◄ Cuminum cyminum; ► it is planted and harvested each year, and its seeds are used in cooking and as medicine

H7760.def: = action by which individuals or groups of humans place themselves in a certain position or configuration

H2406.def: = cereal plant bearing dense four-sided spike of grain; ◄ Triticum; ► important source of flour for bread; ≈ its color used to be regarded as the ideal color for the skin

H8184.def: = a type of cultivated grass like wheat or rice; less than 1 m tall; it produces a single head on each stalk, with rows of kernels; ◄ Hordeum distichum or Hordeum vulgare; ► its grain was used to make bread or beer, or for animal feed

H3698.def: meaning unsure, probably: = type of grain with loose ears and triangular grains which do not loosen from the chaff when ripening; grows in relatively infertile and dry soil; with a sweet, nutty flavor; ◄ Triticum dicoccum; ► used for making bread; ≈ regarded as inferior to {L:wheat<SDBH:חִטָּה>}

H1367.def: = a set of limits that separates part of a whole from other parts, with focus either on the limits itself or on the area or object surrounded by it

H430.def: plural with plural meaning: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations

H3256.def: = action by which humans or deities respond to negative behavior of (other) humans by administering some sort of punishment, which may range from a verbal rebuke to physical correction, ► often done with corrective intent, but sometimes also as retribution

H4941.def: = a situation where one party has a dispute with another party, and is looking for a legal ruling in which they receive what they consider to be rightfully theirs

H7100.def: = a cultivated plant that grows to around 30 cm high and has a lacy leaf like dill or carrot and a greenish-blue flower with five petals; the base of the flower becomes a seedpod that contains many round, black, sharp-smelling seeds; ► used in cooking

H1758.def: = causative action by which humans separate grain from straw by having animals trample it or by dragging a threshing board over it; ≈ often used figuratively to denote acts of aggression

H212.def: = ring or round disk with a rod (axle) running through its center or hub; either made as a solid piece of wood or a central hub connected with several spokes to an outher rim; ◄ made of wood and sometimes partly of iron; ► used to help vehicles move over the ground, and occasionally for other purposes, such as threshing grain

H5699.def: = two or four-wheeled carriage or cart, used for travel or the transport of loads; pulled by draft animals, such as {L:oxen<SDBH:שֹׁור>}, {L:donkeys<SDBH:חֲמֹור>}, or {L:horses<SDBH:סוּס>}

H5437.def: = process by which a door is attached to a wall by means of a {L:hinge<SDBH:צִיר>}, or a contraption with a similar function, which allows it to pivot

H3646.def: meaning unsure; probably: = a plant of the same family as the carrot, reaching a height of 50-60 cm; it branches from the base and has similar leaves and flowers, though its seeds have a sharper smell; ◄ Cuminum cyminum; ► it is planted and harvested each year, and its seeds are used in cooking and as medicine

H2251.def: = action by which humans strike another object repeatedly + with a stick or a similar wooden instrument, ► so that items attached to this object will be released

H7626.def: = stick ◄ usually made of wood; ► attribute of a shepherd or a ruler, but also used for other purposes, such as beating, walking, fighting, etc.; ≈ associated with shepherding, authority, punishment

H3899.def: = a staple food ◄ made from a dough of water and either wheat or barley then baked; ► together with water considered the very basis of life, often used to refer to food in general

H1854.def: = state in which an object has been reduced to fine particles

H1758.def: = causative action by which humans separate grain from straw by having animals trample it or by dragging a threshing board over it; ≈ often used figuratively to denote acts of aggression

H5331.def: poetic term: = a long duration of time that is or may seem unending, usually in the future

H156.def: = causative action by which humans separate grain from straw by having animals trample it or by dragging a threshing board over it; ≈ often used figuratively to denote acts of aggression

H1536.def: = ring or round disk with a rod (axle) running through its center or hub; either made of a solid piece of wood or a central hub connected with several spokes to an outer rim; ◄ made of wood and sometimes partly of iron; ► used to help vehicles move over the ground

H5699.def: = two or four-wheeled carriage or cart, used for travel or the transport of loads; pulled by draft animals, such as {L:oxen<SDBH:שֹׁור>}, {L:donkeys<SDBH:חֲמֹור>}, or {L:horses<SDBH:סוּס>}

H2000.def: = causative process by which deities cause humans to be overwhelmed with fear and flee

H1571.def: marker pointing to information that needs to be considered in addition to previous information (either explicit or implied)

H3318.def: = action by which humans, animals, or objects leave a certain place or position

H3068.def: = deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

H6635.def: = state of being in the service of the community; ≈ sometimes associated with suffering and heavy labor

H6381.def: = state in which an event is out of the ordinary, inspiring amazement, and usually associated with the supernatural

H1431.def: = process by which objects increase in size

16.gl: to do (something) in an extraordinary way
